qas.question: Why did India stop supporting the military in Myanmar in 2008 ?

answers.text: over the issue of human rights abuses by the ruling junta

qas.question: Did the military sanctions imposed by India affect the business workings of it's relations in Burma ?

answers.text: it has preserved extensive commercial ties

qas.question: Who helped to improve the relations between India and Burma?

answers.text: Belarusian Prime Minister Mikhail Myasnikovich and his wife Ludmila

qas.question: What city in Burma was visited by the envoy from India

context: In 2008, India suspended military aid to Myanmar <a0_0>over the issue of human rights abuses by the ruling junta<a0_0/>, although <a1_0>it has preserved extensive commercial ties<a1_0/>, which provide the regime with much-needed revenue. The thaw in relations began on 28 November 2011, when <a2_0>Belarusian Prime Minister Mikhail Myasnikovich and his wife Ludmila<a2_0/> arrived in <a3_0>the capital, Naypyidaw<a3_0/>, the same day as the country received a visit by US Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, who also met with pro-democracy opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi. International relations progress indicators continued in September 2012 when Aung San Suu Kyi visited to the US followed by Myanmar's reformist president visit to the United Nations.
